title: important: Apache HTTP Server: SSRF with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context on Windows (CVE-2024-40898)
content:
I reported this vulnerability through the official Apache HTTP Server security email on 2024-07-12, and received a CVE number on 2024-07-17. You can check detailed information from here:
https://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_24.html
Impact
SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context, allows to potentially leak NTLM hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests.
steps: Configure an Apache HTTP Server on Windows with mod_rewrite enabled in server/vhost context.
Craft a malicious request that leverages mod_rewrite rules to perform an SSRF, potentially leaking NTLM hashes to a malicious server.
vuln_description: This vulnerability is an SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) in Apache HTTP Server on Windows when mod_rewrite is used in server/vhost context. It allows an attacker to potentially leak NTLM hashes to a malicious server via crafted requests.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the interaction between mod_rewrite rules and Windows-specific NTLM authentication, which is a non-obvious interaction. Additionally, the attacker needs to craft specific requests to exploit this interaction, adding to the complexity.
